article.headline: Delaware 54, Santa Clara 53
article.story: SANTA CLARA, Calif. -- Devon Saddler scored 12 points, including a key basket down the stretch, to help Delaware beat Santa Clara 54-53 in the first round of the Cable Car Classic on Wednesday night. Malcolm Hawkins recorded a career-high 10 rebounds for the Blue Hens (6-4), snapping a two-game losing streak. Kevin Foster scored six of his 13 points in the final 1:24 but ran into trouble under the basket as time expired. Raymond Cowels scored all 13 of his points in the first half for the Broncos (7-7), who fell to 5-3 at home. Santa Clara led at halftime 29-23. With about two minutes left, Saddler grabbed a loose ball and took it the length of the court for a layup to give Delaware a seven-point lead. The Blue Hens stayed ahead after that. Delaware advances to the championship game and will play the winner of a later game between American and Fordham.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
